Key Match Events: Nsue scored a hat-trick for Equatorial Guinea with goals in the 21st, 51st, and 61st minutes.
Obiang scored an own goal in the 37th minute.
Nlavo scored for Guinea-Bissau in the 83rd minute.
Buyla scored for Guinea-Bissau in the 90+5th minute.
Correia scored for Guinea-Bissau in the 90+3rd minute.
Miranda scored for Equatorial Guinea in the 46th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Both teams gave good accounts of themselves in their respective opening matches.
Equatorial Guinea are unbeaten in their last 11 outings across all competitions.
Guinea-Bissau have let in a whopping eight goals across their last two matches.
Ouparine Djoco looks to have usurped Jonas Mendes in the battle for Guinea-Bissau's number one spot.
Thirty-two-year-old Opa Sangante could be dropped to the substitutes' bench for this one, having a day to forget against Ivory Coast last time out.
Following his opener against Nigeria, Iban Salvador has now scored six times for Equatorial Guinea, with only Emilio Nsue finding the back of the net on more occasions of the 27-man AFCON squad.
Midfielder Federico Bikoro is set to make his 49th international cap, which would see him move within one of half a century of appearances.
Post-Match Reflections: Equatorial Guinea got their AFCON campaign up and running with all three points here.
Guinea-Bissau were on the receiving end of a comprehensive 2-0 defeat against tournament hosts Ivory Coast at the Olympic Stadium of Ebimpe on Saturday evening.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Stade Olympique Alassane Ouattara in Abidjan.
The match was part of Group A in the Africa Cup of Nations.
The match was played on January 18, 2024, at 2pm UK time.
Others: Our expert tipster partners at Sporita.com are predicting under 2.5 goals in this match.
